verse_text: Then, after the death of Ahab, Moab transgressed against Israel

And Ahaziah fell down through the lattices of his upper room, which he had in Samaria, and he was injured. And he sent messengers, saying to them, â€œGo, consult Beelzebub, the god of Ekron, as to whether I may be able to survive this infirmity of mine.

And an Angel of the Lord spoke to Elijah, the Tishbite, saying: â€œRise up, and ascend to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria. And you shall say to them: â€˜Is there not a God in Israel, so that you would go to consult Beelzebub, the god of Ekron
For this reason, thus says the Lord: From the bed to which you have ascended, you shall not descend. Instead, dying you shall die.â€™ â€ And Elijah went away
And the messengers returned to Ahaziah. And he said to them, â€œWhy have you returned?

But they responded to him: â€œA man met us, and he said to us: â€˜Go, and return to the king who sent you. And you shall say to him: Thus says the Lord: Is it because there was no God in Israel that you are sending to consult Beelzebub, the god of Ekron? Therefore, from the bed to which you have ascended, you shall not descend. Instead, dying you shall die.â€™
And he said to them: â€œWhat was the appearance and dress of that man, who met you and who spoke these words?
So they said, â€œA hairy man, with a belt of leather wrapping his waist.â€ And he said, â€œIt is Elijah, the Tishbite.
And he sent to him a leader of fifty, with the fifty who were under him. And he ascended to him, sitting at the top of a hill, and he said, â€œMan of God, the king commanded that you should descend.

And responding, Elijah said to the leader of fifty, â€œIf I am a man of God, let fire from heaven descend and devour you and your fifty.â€ And then fire from heaven descended and devoured him and the fifty who were with him
And again, he sent to him another leader of fifty, and the fifty with him. And he said to him, â€œMan of God, thus says the king: Hurry, descend.
Responding, Elijah said, â€œIf I am a man of God, let fire from heaven descend and devour you and your fifty.â€ And fire from heaven descended and devoured him and his fifty

Again, he sent a third leader of fifty men and the fifty who were with him. And when he had arrived, he bent his knees before Elijah, and he pleaded with him, and said: â€œMan of God, do not choose to despise my life and the lives of your servants who are with me
Behold, fire from heaven descended and devoured the two previous leaders of fifty and the fifties who were with them. But now I beg you to take pity on my life.
Then the Angel of the Lord spoke to Elijah, saying, â€œDescend with him; fear not.â€ And so, he arose and descended with him to the king

And he said to him: â€œThus says the Lord: Because you sent messengers to consult Beelzebub, the god of Ekron, as if there were no God in Israel, from whom you would be able to seek a word, therefore, from the bed to which you have ascended, you shall not descend. Instead, dying you shall die.

And so he died, in accord with the word of the Lord, which Elijah spoke. And Jehoram, his brother, reigned in his place, in the second year of Jehoram, the son of Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah. For he had no son
But the rest of the words of Ahaziah that he worked, have these not been written in the book of the words of the days of the kings of Israel
